title: Accessing raw mass spectrometry data from a grover API
text: vignette outlines grover package client-side functionality accessing raw mass spectrometry data repository hosted grover API. functionality includes repository contents querying, file transfer, file information retrieval, sample information retrieval raw data conversion. get started can first load grover package.
code: library(grover)

title: Accessing raw mass spectrometry data from a grover API
text: example run example grover API provided package. run background process allow us interact API without use alterative R console. activate run following: details hosting grover API see Hosting grover API vignette.
code: grover_host <- grover(host = "127.0.0.1",                      port = 8000,                      auth = "1234",                      repository = system.file('repository',                                               package = 'grover'))  api <- groverAPI(grover_host,                  background = TRUE,                  log_dir = paste0(tempdir(),'/logs'),                  temp_dir = paste0(tempdir(),'/temp'))

title: Accessing raw mass spectrometry data from a grover API
text: order access API, need first provide host details grover API. two ways . primary method use configuration file can parsed specified API activated. YAML format structure shown : specifies host address, port, authentication key matches key host configured. package contains example file can parse using readGrover() function. returns S4 object class GroverClient contains API host information. host information can viewed printing object: second method, method used example, specify host details directly using grover() function like following: enables us access grover API hosting example data repository included package. Using host information, can first check API running using extant() function shown :
code: host: 127.0.0.1 port: 8000 auth: 1234 grover_client <- readGrover(system.file('grover_client.yml',package = 'grover')) print(grover_client) #>  #> Grover Information #>  #> Host:        127.0.0.1  #> Port:         8000  #> Authentication:   1234 grover_client <- grover(host = "127.0.0.1",                      port = 8000,                      auth = "1234") extant(grover_client) #> [1] TRUE

title: Accessing raw mass spectrometry data from a grover API
text: can list instruments available within data reposiroty using following: can seen , single instrument available named Thermo-Exactive. list experiment directories available instrument, can use code . shows single experiment data directory available. can list contents directory identify data files available: can see single raw data file available example repository.
code: listInstruments(grover_client) #> [1] "Thermo-Exactive" listDirectories(grover_client,'Thermo-Exactive') #> [1] "Experiment_1" listFiles(grover_client,'Thermo-Exactive','Experiment_1') #> [1] "QC01.raw"

title: Accessing raw mass spectrometry data from a grover API
text: File Information file size creation date retrieved. can see example file QC01.raw using following: can also done directory wide multiple files available.
code: fileInfo(grover_client,'Thermo-Exactive','Experiment_1','QC01.raw') #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   instrument      directory    file     extension        size  birth_time #>   <chr>           <chr>        <chr>    <chr>     <fs::bytes>       <dbl> #> 1 Thermo-Exactive Experiment_1 QC01.raw raw             6.88M 1674053574. directoryFileInfo(grover_client,'Thermo-Exactive','Experiment_1') #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   instrument      directory    file     extension        size  birth_time #>   <chr>           <chr>        <chr>    <chr>     <fs::bytes>       <dbl> #> 1 Thermo-Exactive Experiment_1 QC01.raw raw             6.88M 1674053574.

title: Accessing raw mass spectrometry data from a grover API
text: Individual files can transferred repository using transferFile() , stipulating instrument, experiment directory file name. outDir argument allows us declare file downloaded . example , file transfered current working directory. Similarly, can transfer entire directory:
code: transferFile(grover_client,              'Thermo-Exactive',              'Experiment_1',              'QC01.raw',              outDir = '.') transferDirectory(grover_client,                   'Thermo-Exactive',                   'Experiment_1',                   outDir = '.')

title: Accessing raw mass spectrometry data from a grover API
text: Thermo .raw mass spectrometry data files contain sample meta information within file headers. can extracted retrieved, form tibble, given file using: Similarly, sample information entire experiment run can retrieved :
code: sampleInfo(grover_client,'Thermo-Exactive','Experiment_1','QC01.raw') #>  QC01.raw  [32m✔ [39m #>  [38;5;246m# A tibble: 1 × 39 [39m #>   `RAW file` RAW file …¹ Creat…² Opera…³ Numbe…⁴ Descr…⁵ Instr…⁶ Instr…⁷ Instr…⁸ #>    [3m [38;5;246m<chr> [39m [23m       [3m [38;5;246m<chr> [39m [23m        [3m [38;5;246m<chr> [39m [23m    [3m [38;5;246m<chr> [39m [23m      [3m [38;5;246m<dbl> [39m [23m  [3m [38;5;246m<chr> [39m [23m    [3m [38;5;246m<chr> [39m [23m    [3m [38;5;246m<chr> [39m [23m    [3m [38;5;246m<chr> [39m [23m   #>  [38;5;250m1 [39m QC01.raw   64          04/25/… Thermo        2  [38;5;246m" [39m [38;5;246m" [39m      Exacti… Thermo… C:/Xca… #>  [38;5;246m# … with 30 more variables: `Serial number` <chr>, `Software version` <chr>, [39m #>  [38;5;246m#   `Firmware version` <chr>, Units <chr>, `Mass resolution` <chr>, [39m #>  [38;5;246m#   `Number of scans` <dbl>, `Number of ms2 scans` <dbl>, `Scan range` <dbl>, [39m #>  [38;5;246m#   `Time range` <dbl>, `Mass range` <dbl>, `Scan filter (first scan)` <chr>, [39m #>  [38;5;246m#   `Scan filter (last scan)` <chr>, `Total number of filters` <chr>, [39m #>  [38;5;246m#   `Sample name` <chr>, `Sample id` <chr>, `Sample type` <chr>, [39m #>  [38;5;246m#   `Sample comment` <chr>, `Sample vial` <chr>, `Sample volume` <chr>, … [39m runInfo(grover_client,'Thermo-Exactive','Experiment_1') #>  #> Genrating run info table for Experiment_1 containing 1 .raw files #> # A tibble: 1 × 39 #>   `RAW file` RAW file …¹ Creat…² Opera…³ Numbe…⁴ Descr…⁵ Instr…⁶ Instr…⁷ Instr…⁸ #>   <chr>      <chr>       <chr>   <chr>     <dbl> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   #> 1 QC01.raw   64          04/25/… Thermo        2 ""      Exacti… Thermo… C:/Xca… #> # … with 30 more variables: `Serial number` <chr>, `Software version` <chr>, #> #   `Firmware version` <chr>, Units <chr>, `Mass resolution` <chr>, #> #   `Number of scans` <dbl>, `Number of ms2 scans` <dbl>, `Scan range` <dbl>, #> #   `Time range` <dbl>, `Mass range` <dbl>, `Scan filter (first scan)` <chr>, #> #   `Scan filter (last scan)` <chr>, `Total number of filters` <chr>, #> #   `Sample name` <chr>, `Sample id` <chr>, `Sample type` <chr>, #> #   `Sample comment` <chr>, `Sample vial` <chr>, `Sample volume` <chr>, …

title: Accessing raw mass spectrometry data from a grover API
text: grover also possible retrieve .mzML format data files, converted .raw files. file conversion uses command line tool msconvert, implemented R msconverteR package.

title: Accessing raw mass spectrometry data from a grover API
text: retrieve example .raw file .mzML format, convertFile() function can used. takes similar inputs transferFile() shown previously.
code: convertFile(grover_client,             'Thermo-Exactive',             'Experiment_1',             'QC01.raw',             outDir = '.') convertDirectory(grover_client,             'Thermo-Exactive',             'Experiment_1',             outDir = '.')

title: Accessing raw mass spectrometry data from a grover API
text: args argument can supplied conversion functions pass specific conversion criterial msconvert. grover package contains number helper functions simplify use. available functions listed . Calling functions return appropriate string argument passed msconvert. Mutiple functions can also combined. full list available msconvert arguments can found . example shows use conversionArgsPeakPick() retrieve centroided data .mzML format.
code: conversionArgsMSlevel1 conversionArgsMSlevel2 conversionArgsMSlevel3 conversionArgsNegativeMode conversionArgsPeakPick conversionArgsPositiveMode conversionArgsPeakPick() #> [1] "peakPicking true 1-" paste(conversionArgsPeakPick(),conversionArgsNegativeMode()) #> [1] "peakPicking true 1- polarity negative" convertFile(grover_client,             'Thermo-Exactive',             'Experiment_1',             'QC01.raw',             args = conversionArgsPeakPick(),              outDir = '.')

title: Accessing raw mass spectrometry data from a grover API
text: conclude, can terminte process running example grover API instance.
code: api$kill() #> [1] TRUE

title: Hosting a grover API
text: vignette outlines steps required hosting web API providing web access mass spectrometry data repository. includes repository structure, specifying host configuration, running API request logging. get started can first load grover package.
code: library(grover)

title: Hosting a grover API
text: structure data repository consist hierarchy directories within central data repository directory. structure outlined . Within central data repository directory instrument directories specifying mass spectrometers data generated. Within instrument directories, data organised directories experiment. experiment directories contain .raw mass spectrometry data files associated files meta information instrument methods.
code: [34mrepository [39m └── [34minstrument [39m    └── [34mexperiment [39m       └── [32msample.raw [39m

title: Hosting a grover API
text: order activate API, first need specify host details. can done two ways. primary method use configuration file can parsed specified API activated. YAML format structure shown : specifies host address, port, authentication key data security host system directory path data repository. package contains example file can parse using readGrover() function. returns S4 object class GroverHost contains API host information. host information can viewed printing object: second method, method used example, specify host details directly using grover() function like following: enables us host example data repository included package.
code: host: 127.0.0.1 port: 8000 auth: 1234 repository: ./data grover_host <- readGrover(system.file('grover_host.yml',package = 'grover')) print(grover_host) #>  #> Grover Information #>  #> Host:        127.0.0.1  #> Port:         8000  #> Authentication:   1234  #> Repository:   ./data grover_host <- grover(host = "127.0.0.1",                      port = 8000,                      auth = "1234",                      repository = system.file('repository',                                               package = 'grover'))

title: Hosting a grover API
text: API can activated using groverAPI(). purposes example, background argument also specified TRUE enable API run background process. enable us interact API without move alternative R console. Run following start API: log_dir argument also specified. See final section details request logging API. Running API background returns callr package process object. can test status background process API running using: test API client side, extant() function can used test API live. details client-side access hosted mass spectrometry data, see Accessing raw mass spectrometry data grover API vignette. Finally, background API process can terminated using: details options securely deploying web APIs can found part plumber package documentation .
code: api <- groverAPI(grover_host,                  background = TRUE,                  log_dir = paste0(tempdir(),'/logs'),                  temp_dir = paste0(tempdir(),'/temp')) api$is_alive() #> [1] TRUE extant(grover_host) #> [1] TRUE api$kill() #> [1] TRUE

title: Hosting a grover API
text: log_dir argument can also found call groverAPI() previous section. example, logs directory within temporary directory specified. snippet can used identify log files generated API request. contents log file can access : log entry shows single request using extant() whilst API live. log entry also includes, order appearance, data time request, request type, requested function, auth argument specified, status request processing time request.
code: logs <- list.files(paste0(tempdir(),'/logs'),full.names = TRUE) logs #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpVxYacF/logs/grover_2023-01-18.log" readLines(logs[1]) #> [1] "INFO [2023-01-18 14:54:52] GET /extant 1234 200 0.033"

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jasen Finch. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Finch J (2023). grover: Web API Framework Mass Spectrometry Data Transfer. R package version 1.1.1, https://jasenfinch.github.io/grover/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {grover: Web API Framework for Mass Spectrometry Data Transfer},   author = {Jasen Finch},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 1.1.1},   url = {https://jasenfinch.github.io/grover/}, }

title: Web API Framework for Mass Spectrometry Data Transfer
text: grover package provides web-based API framework remote access mass spectrometry .raw data repository, implemented using plumber R package. API functionality includes: File information retrieval including file size creation dates. File transfer. Raw mass spectrometry data file conversion .mzML format. Retrieval sample information .raw file headers. package functionality platform independent file conversion sample information retrieval functionality available use msconverteR rawrr R packages.

title: Web API Framework for Mass Spectrometry Data Transfer
text: grover package can installed GitHub using following:
code: remotes::install_github('jasenfinch/grover')

title: Web API Framework for Mass Spectrometry Data Transfer
text: package documentation can browsed online https://jasenfinch.github.io/grover/. believe ’ve found bug grover, please file bug (, possible, reproducible example) https://github.com/jasenfinch/grover/issues.

what: Convert raw files to mzML format — convertFile
title: Convert raw files to mzML format — convertFile
text: Convert raw MS file using grover API.

title: Convert raw files to mzML format — convertFile
code: convertFile(   grover_client,   instrument,   directory,   file,   args = "",   outDir = ".",   zip = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE )  convertDirectory(   grover_client,   instrument,   directory,   args = "",   outDir = ".",   zip = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   exclude = character() )  convertDirectorySplitModes(   grover_client,   instrument,   directory,   args = "",   outDir = ".",   zip = TRUE )  # S4 method for GroverClient convertFile(   grover_client,   instrument,   directory,   file,   args = NULL,   outDir = ".",   zip = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE )  # S4 method for GroverClient convertDirectory(   grover_client,   instrument,   directory,   args = "",   outDir = ".",   zip = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   exclude = character() )  # S4 method for GroverClient convertDirectorySplitModes(   grover_client,   instrument,   directory,   args = "",   outDir = ".",   zip = TRUE )

title: Convert raw files to mzML format — convertFile
text: grover_client S4 object class GroverClient instrument instrument name directory directory name file file name args arguments pass msconverteR::convert_files outDir output directory path converted files zip zip converted file overwrite overwrite local mzML files already exist outDir path file name raw files converted exclude character vector regular expression patterns raw files matching patterns converted.

title: Convert raw files to mzML format — convertFile
text: vector file paths converted data files.

what: GroverClient and GroverHost class constructor — grover

code: grover(host, port, auth, repository = NULL)

title: GroverClient and GroverHost class constructor — grover
text: host host address port port API hosted auth authentication key repository data repository directory path

title: GroverClient and GroverHost class constructor — grover
code: ## Grover client  grover_client <- grover(host = "127.0.0.1",                      port = 8000,                      auth = "1234")  ## Grover host grover_host <- grover(host = "127.0.0.1",                      port = 8000,                      auth = "1234",                      repository = system.file('repository',                                                package = 'grover'))

title: Grover API — groverAPI
text: Run grover REST API file conversion.

title: Grover API — groverAPI
code: groverAPI(   grover_host,   background = FALSE,   log_dir = "~/.grover/logs",   temp_dir = tempdir() )

title: Grover API — groverAPI
text: grover_host S4 object class Grover background Run background process. log_dir directory path API logs temp_dir temporary directory converted files

title: Grover API — groverAPI
code: if (FALSE) { grover_host <- grover(host = "127.0.0.1",                      port = 8000,                      auth = "1234",                      repository = system.file('repository',                                                package = 'grover')) groverAPI(grover_host)  }

title: Parse a grover configuration file — readGrover
text: text file contain 3 lines, first host address, second port hosted lastly authentication key needed

title: Parse a grover configuration file — readGrover
code: ## Grover client grover_client <- system.file('grover_client.yml',                               package = 'grover') grover_client <- readGrover(grover_client)  ## Grover host grover_host <- system.file('grover_host.yml',                               package = 'grover') grover_host <- readGrover(grover_host)

title: grover 1.1.1
text: Ensure grover::convertDirectory returns file paths converted .mzML files raw files specified directory.

title: grover 1.1.0
text: Added exclude argument grover::convertDirectory grover::runInfo exclude raw files matching specified patterns. grover::runInfo now collates sample information client-side time_out argument removed. grover::groverAPI log_dir temp_dir argument directories now created recursively already exist. Improved naming grover::groverAPI log files include current system date.

title: grover 1.0.9
text: grover::groverAPI log_dir temp_dir argument directories now created already exist. grover::groverAPI temp_dir argument default now tempdir(). grover::extant now returns TRUE specified API accessible FALSE . argument overwrite now added grover::convertFile grover::convertDirectory enable overwriting local mzML files file name raw files converted. Removed build_vignettes argument installation instructions package README package documetation available online https://jasenfinch.github.io/grover. Removed Introduction vignette majority information duplicated package README.

title: grover 1.0.8
text: Added Bioconductor package rawrr](https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/rawrr.html) abiocremote ensure package can installed correctly using [pak](https://pak.r-lib.org/) [renv`.

title: grover 1.0.7
text: Added biocViews field DESCRIPTION ensure `rawrr Bioconductor dependency installed automatically. Fixed grover::converFile error two options supplied args parameter.

title: grover 1.0.6
text: grover::converFile creates output directory doesn’t already exist. Converted files now correctly zipped grover::converFile ensure readable mzR package.

title: grover 1.0.5
text: File conversion methods grover::converFile grover::convertDirectory now return file path converted file. Zipping converted files reduced storage requirements can now specified using zip argument now default conversion methods grover::converFile. Added grover::version query version number grover API. grover::groverAPI now ensures specified temp_dir created already extant.

title: grover 1.0.4
text: grover::conversionArgsPeakPick fix ensure conversion argument correctly passed msconverteR.

title: grover 1.0.3
text: rawR dependency updated rawrr package name change. Fixed typo grover::runInfo console message. Request timeout limit can now set grover::runInfo. Fixed grover::runInfo attempting retrieve file meta-information corrupt .raw file.

title: grover 1.0.2
text: temp_dir argument added grover::groverAPI enable specification temporary directory converted data storage. Fixed typo grover::convertDirectory console message.

title: grover 1.0.1
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Fixed conversion argument helpers work correctly msconverteR. Converted files now returned correctly API.
